security: This document is marked Top Secret, indicating that its disclosure could cause exceptionally grave damage to national security. Specifically, the document reveals operational details of intelligence gathering related to individuals and groups in Nicaragua, which could compromise ongoing operations and relationships with foreign governments. It also shows how information gathered is disseminated between agencies like the NSA and FBI. Quoting the classification markings: 'TOP SECRET' and 'CLASSIFIED BY 5668-S4/nick'.
summary: A top secret communication from the NSA (relayed by the FBI) to Managua reports a list of individuals, allegedly Nicaraguan, who accompanied Maj. Indalecio Pastora XMolina.
summary_one_paragraph: On March 1, 1960, a top secret message, originating from the NSA and relayed through the FBI, was sent from San Jose to Managua, addressed to President Somoza. The message lists individuals, including Sgt. Gilberto Alvarado Ugarte, who accompanied Maj. Indalecio Pastora XMolina and were claimed to be Nicaraguan. The document, indexed as 0/1663-60, was declassified on April 26, 2018, with an opening criterion of NSA approval and indefinite restrictions.
title: [Restricted]
